text: Nebuchadnezzar Declares What the Most High God Has Done for Him

\f + \fr 4:1 \ft \xt Daniel 4:1–4:37 \ft in the English Bible is 3:31–4:34 in the Hebrew Bible \f* Nebuchadnezzar the king to all of the nations, the peoples and languages that live in the whole earth: “May your prosperity increase!
It is pleasing to me to recount the signs and wonders that the Most High God worked for me.

How great \add are\add* his signs and wonders, how strong \add is\add* his kingdom, ⸤an everlasting kingdom⸥;\f + \fr 4:3 \ft Literally “a kingdom of eternity” \f* and his sovereignty is from generation to generation.
The Dream and the King’s Search for an Interpreter
“I, Nebuchadnezzar, was content in my house and prospering in my palace.
And I saw a dream and a revelation on my bed and it frightened me, and the visions of my head terrified me.

And a decree was ⸤sent out⸥,\f + \fr 4:6 \ft Literally “put/placed” \f* \add ordering that\add* all \add the\add* wise men of Babylon \add were\add* to be brought in before me \add so\add* that they may make known to me \add the\add* explanation of the dream.

Then the magicians,\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Or “soothsayer-priests” \f* the conjurers,\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Or “enchanters” \f* the ⸤astrologers⸥\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Literally “Chaldeans” \f* and the diviners came in and I told them the dream, but they could not make known to me its explanation.\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Or “interpretation” \f*

Then ⸤at last⸥\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Literally “until another” \f* Daniel came before me ⸤whose name was⸥\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Literally “who name his” \f* Belteshazzar, ⸤according to⸥\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Literally “like” \f* the name of my god, \add and\add* ⸤in whom was the spirit of the holy gods⸥,\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Literally “and who \fq the \ft spirit of gods holy in him” \f* ⸤and I related the dream to him⸥.\f + \fr 4:8 \ft Literally “and the dream before him I told” \f*

“ ‘\add O\add* Belteshazzar, chief of the magicians,\f + \fr 4:9 \ft Or “soothsayer-priests” \f* I myself know that \add the\add* spirit\f + \fr 4:9 \ft Or “a spirit” \f* of \add the\add* holy gods \add is\add* in you, and ⸤no mystery is too difficult⸥\f + \fr 4:9 \ft Literally “every mystery is not difficult” \f* for you. \add Now\add* tell \add me\add* \add the\add* visions of my dream that I saw, and its explanation.\f + \fr 4:9 \ft Or “interpretation” \f*

Now \add these were\add* the visions of my head \add as I was lying\add* on my bed: I was ⸤gazing⸥\f + \fr 4:10 \ft Literally “seeing” \f* and, look, a tree \add was\add* in the midst of the earth, and its height \add was\add* exalted.
The tree grew and it became strong,
and its height reached to heaven,\f + \fr 4:11 \ft Or “the sky” \f*
and ⸤it was visible to the end of the whole earth⸥.\f + \fr 4:11 \ft Literally “and its appearance \fq was \ft to \fq the \ft end of the whole earth” \f*
Its foliage \add was\add* beautiful,
and its fruit abundant,
and in it \add was\add* provision for all.
Under it the animals\f + \fr 4:12 \ft Aramaic “animal” \f* of the field sought shade,
and in its branches the birds of heaven\f + \fr 4:12 \ft Or “the sky” \f* nested,
and from it all the living beings were fed.
“ ‘I was looking in the vision of my head \add as I lay\add* on my bed, and look, a watcher,\f + \fr 4:13 \ft Or “angelic being” \f* and \add a\add* holy \add one\add*, came down from heaven.
He cried ⸤aloud⸥\f + \fr 4:14 \ft Literally “in strength” \f* and so he said:
“Cut down the tree and chop off its branches;
shake off its foliage and scatter its fruit.
Let the animals flee from under it,
and the birds from its branches.
But the stump of its roots
leave in the earth,
⸤along with⸥\f + \fr 4:15 \ft Literally “and with” \f* a band of iron and bronze;
\add leave it\add* in the grass of the field.
And in\f + \fr 4:15 \ft Or “with” \f* the dew of heaven
let it\f + \fr 4:15 \ft Or “him,” that is, the king \f* be watered,
and with the animals\f + \fr 4:15 \ft Aramaic “animal” \f*
let his lot \add be\add* in \add the\add* grass of the earth.
Let his mind be changed from \add that of a\add* human,\f + \fr 4:16 \ft Or “the human” \f*
and let \add the\add* mind of an animal be given to him,
and let seven times pass over him.
The sentence \add is\add* by \add the\add* decree of \add the\add* watchers,
and the decision \add by\add* \add the\add* command of \add the\add* holy \add ones\add*,
⸤in order that⸥\f + \fr 4:17 \ft Literally “until matter that” \f* the living will know
that the Most High \add is\add* sovereign over \add the\add* kingdom of humankind,
and ⸤to whomever⸥\f + \fr 4:17 \ft Literally “to whom that” \f* he wills he gives it,
and he \add even\add* sets \add the\add* humblest of men over it.”

“ ‘This \add is\add* the dream \add that\add* I, Nebuchadnezzar the king, saw. Now\f + \fr 4:18 \ft Or “And” \f* you, Belteshazzar, declare its explanation, ⸤for⸥\f + \fr 4:18 \ft Literally “all of because that” \f* all of \add the\add* wise men of my kingdom were not able to make the explanation known to me, but you are able because \add the\add* spirit of holy gods \add is\add* in you.’
Daniel Relates and Interprets the Dream

“Then Daniel, whose name \add was\add* Belteshazzar, was distressed ⸤for some time⸥,\f + \fr 4:19 \ft Literally “for one hour” \f* and his thoughts disturbed him. The king answered and he said, ‘Belteshazzar, let the dream and its explanation not disturb you.’ Belteshazzar answered and said, ‘My lord, \add may\add* the dream and its explanation \add be\add* for \add those who\add* hate you and for your enemies.

The tree that you saw, which grew and became strong and its height reached to heaven\f + \fr 4:20 \ft Or “the sky” \f* and ⸤it was visible to the end of the whole earth⸥,\f + \fr 4:20 \ft Literally “its appearance to the all the earth” \f*

and its foliage \add was\add* beautiful and its fruit abundant, and \add so there was\add* provision for all in it, \add and\add* the animals\f + \fr 4:21 \ft Aramaic “animal” \f* of the field lived under it and in its branches nest \add the\add* birds of heaven,\f + \fr 4:21 \ft Or “the sky” \f*

—it is you, O king, who have grown \add great\add* and you have grown strong, and \add so\add* your greatness has increased and it has reached to heaven\f + \fr 4:22 \ft Or “the sky” \f* and your sovereignty to the end of the earth.

And \add inasmuch\add* that the king saw \add the\add* watcher, a holy \add one\add* coming down from heaven\f + \fr 4:23 \ft Or “the sky” \f* and he said, “Cut down the tree and destroy it, but the stump of its root in the earth leave with a band of iron and bronze in the grass of the field, and let it be watered with the dew of heaven and \add let\add* his lot \add be\add* with \add the\add* animals of the field ⸤until seven times have passed over him⸥.”\f + \fr 4:23 \ft Literally “until that seven times \fq they \ft pass over him” \f*
This \add is\add* the explanation, O king, and it \add is\add* a decree of the Most High that has come upon my lord the king:

you will be driven away ⸤from human society⸥\f + \fr 4:25 \ft Literally “from the humankind” \f* and ⸤you will dwell⸥\f + \fr 4:25 \ft Literally “your dwelling will be” \f* with the animals\f + \fr 4:25 \ft Aramaic “animal” \f* of the field, and you will be caused to graze grass like the oxen ⸤yourself⸥,\f + \fr 4:25 \ft Literally “with respect to you” \f* and you will be watered with the dew of heaven, and seven \add periods of\add* time will pass over you until that you have acknowledged that the Most High \add is\add* sovereign over the kingdom of humankind, and ⸤to whom he wills⸥\f + \fr 4:25 \ft Literally “that he wills” \f* he gives it.

⸤And in that⸥\f + \fr 4:26 \ft Literally “And for” \f* they said to leave alone the stump of the tree’s root, so your kingdom \add will be\add* restored for you ⸤when⸥\f + \fr 4:26 \ft Literally “from that” \f* you acknowledge that heaven \add is\add* sovereign.

Therefore, O king, let my advice be acceptable \add to you\add* and your sin remove\f + \fr 4:27 \ft Or “replace” \f* with righteousness and your iniquity with having mercy on \add the\add* oppressed, ⸤in case there might be a prolongation of your prosperity⸥.’ ”\f + \fr 4:27 \ft Literally “if will be prolongation for your prosperity” \f*
God Judges the King for His Hubris
⸤All this happened⸥\f + \fr 4:28 \ft Literally “It came upon” \f* to Nebuchadnezzar the king.
At the end of twelve months he was walking on the \add roof of\add* ⸤the royal palace⸥\f + \fr 4:29 \ft Literally “the place of the kingdom” \f* of Babylon.
And the king answered and said, “Is this not the great Babylon which I have built as a royal palace by the strength of my own power, and for the glory of my own majesty?”

\add While\add* the words \add were\add* still in the mouth of the king, a voice from heaven came, \add saying\add*, ‘To you, King Nebuchadnezzar, \add it\add* is declared that the kingdom has departed from you,

and you will be driven away from ⸤human society⸥\f + \fr 4:32 \ft Literally “the humankind” \f* and your dwelling \add will be\add* with the animals\f + \fr 4:32 \ft Aramaic “animal” \f* of the field and they will cause you to graze \add the\add* grass like oxen, and seven times will pass over you, until you acknowledge that the Most High \add is\add* sovereign over the kingdom of humankind and that he gives it to whom he wills.’

⸤Immediately⸥\f + \fr 4:33 \ft Literally “In that hour” \f* the word was fulfilled ⸤concerning⸥\f + \fr 4:33 \ft Literally “over” \f* Nebuchadnezzar, and he was expelled from ⸤human society⸥\f + \fr 4:33 \ft Literally “the humankind” \f* and he ate grass like oxen, and his body was bathed with the dew of heaven until his hair \add was\add* like \add the hair of\add* an eagle and his nails grew like \add a\add* bird’s \add claws\add*.
The King Praises and Extols the Most High God

“But at the end of ⸤that period⸥,\f + \fr 4:34 \ft Literally “the day” \f* I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted up my eyes to heaven, and \add then\add* my reason returned to me; and I blessed the Most High and ⸤the one who lives forever⸥\f + \fr 4:34 \ft Literally “\fq the one \ft living forever” \f* I praised and I honored.
“For his sovereignty \add is\add* \add an\add* everlasting sovereignty,
and his kingdom \add continues\add* from generation to generation.
And all the dwellers of the earth
are regarded as nothing,
and he does ⸤according to⸥\f + \fr 4:35 \ft Literally “as” \f* his desire
in the host of heaven and \add among\add* the dwellers of earth,
and there is not \add one\add* who can hold back his hand,
or ⸤ask him⸥,\f + \fr 4:35 \ft Literally “or asks to him” \f* ‘What are you doing?’

“⸤At that time⸥\f + \fr 4:36 \ft Literally “In it the time” \f* my reason returned to me, and \add also\add* the glory of my kingdom and my majesty and splendor returned to me, and my advisers and my lords\f + \fr 4:36 \ft Or “nobles” \f* searched \add me\add* out, and I was established over my kingdom and abundant greatness was added to me.

Now I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise and exalt and honor the king of heaven, for all his works \add are\add* truth,\f + \fr 4:37 \ft Or “true” \f* and his ways \add are\add* justice and that he is able to humble those who walk in pride.”
